thread.title_full: SpectrumMAX Joins Competitive Carriers Association, Showcases New Technology at CCA Annual Convention 2015

author: Bridgette King
title: SpectrumMAX Joins Competitive Carriers Association, Showcases New Technology at CCA Annual Convention 2015
text:
SpectrumMAX, a division of Carnegie Technologies, announced today that is has joined the membership of the Competitive Carriers Association and will be demonstrating its new SpectrumMAX solution at the CCA Annual Convention 2015 October 7-9 in Fort Lauderdale. The SpectrumMAX solution is designed to give control back to the carriers by providing Wi-Fi Calling, SMS/MMS and Rich Messaging services branded for Mobile Network Operators and MVNOs around the globe. The SpectrumMAX solution includes a mobile client, cloud-based servers and seamless interconnection to 2G, 3G and 4G networks. It allows smartphones (Android and iPhone) to utilize Wi-Fi networks worldwide and provides a practical low cost, easily deployable alternative to DAS, smallcell and femotcell deployments. Using existing network interfaces, it postpones the need for carriers to move to an IMS core network.
“Our product provides a superior, carrier-based solution and competitive response to the OTT messaging threat,” says Mike Karageorge, EVP Business Development for SpectrumMAX. “We help operators reduce their costs by offering an innovative solution that can be deployed quickly and easily with no network changes and no CAPEX outlay. SpectrumMAX enables carriers to fight back in the marketplace and keep the valuable subscribers they’ve worked so hard to earn.”
SpectrumMAX offers carriers a smart, reliable cloud-based solution with numerous benefits including:
Rapid deployment – can be operational in weeks; no network changes required Extend and improve indoor coverage – instantly turn every Wi-Fi access point around the globe into an extension of your network Reduce churn/retain customers – comprehensive Rich Messaging features help stop the bleeding of messaging revenue lost to OTT apps Works on both GSM and CDMA-based mobile networks – and client software works on most Android and iOS smartphones More Cost Effective than other Wi-Fi solutions: o No network changes required
 o No CAPEX outlay required
 o No OEM device development required
SpectrumMAX welcomes CCA Annual Convention attendees to join the company in its booth #211 for a celebration of its CCA membership. For more information, please visit http://www.SpectrumMAX.com
About SpectrumMax
SpectrumMax, a division of Carnegie Technologies, is based in San Antonio, Texas and was created as the result of three years of development by the collective IT groups from Pocket Communications, a mobile network operator based in San Antonio, TX, and the app/device software development group from Houdinisoft, the industry leader in unlocking and re-provisioning ("flashing") CDMA cellular phones. Pocket built and delivered a 500-cell site CDMA cellular network that grew to 385,000 subscribers before being sold in 2010 to Cricket Communications (now owned by AT&T). In 2008, Houdinisoft created the "flashing" industry using a SaaS model to unlock and reprovision CDMA devices allowing them to operate on a different network. Since inception, the company has converted three million devices for more than 20 North American CDMA MNOs. For more information, visit http://www.SpectrumMAX.com
